comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: See en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amos_Pinchot I suspect this is in Newport, RI. According to NYT of July 21, 1913 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9902E0D9153FE633A... Mr. and Mrs. Amos Pinchot had "taken Pinard Cottage No. 4" in Newport.

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
The building at left, with two courses of scalloped shingles, also appears in the background of this Bain/LOC photo:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/3931851782/in/photostream/]

comment.author: 23103743@N05
comment._content: This (the first) Mrs.Amos Pinchot is the former Gertrude Minturn. A bio of Amos Pinchot is at www.spartacus.schoolnet.co.uk/USApinchotA.htm The uncontested divorce of Amos Pinchot by Gertrude was reported in NYT On Dec 9. 1918 query.nytimes.com/gst/abstract.html?res=9505E3D61239E13AB... The NYT article reports that daughter Rosalind was 17 (in 1918 when her parents divorced). www.newyorksocialdiary.com/node/136306 has the daughter of Gertrude Minturn Pinchot as Rosamond, and a picture of Gertrude

comment.author: 70251312@N00
comment._content:
Another Bain/LOC photo of Mrs. Gertrude Pinchot and her daughter, Rosamund:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/library_of_congress/4036730661/in/photostream/]
